document.docAuthor: Binoy, C., Kumar, P. Girish & Santhosh, S.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Indian Dasyproctus Lepeletier & Brullé 1835 (Hymenoptera Crabronidae) with description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Indian Dasyproctus Lepeletier & Brullé 1835 (Hymenoptera Crabronidae) with description of four new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dasyproctus ceylonicus de Saussure 1867: 85
. ♀ : Sri Lanka .
Leclercq, 1956: 162
;
1957: 55
.

Dasyproctus indicus
de Saussure 1892: 582
. ♂ : India : West Bengal .

Crabro infantulus
Kohl 1894: 284
. ♂ : India : West Bengal .

Dasyproctus agilis : Leclercq, 1956: 161
(synonymy for
Crabro agilis F. Smith
); 1972: 109.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Clypeus with a very sharp indentation in the form of a semi-circle without any lateral denticles in females; in males, clypeus medially produced, apical margin truncated; IOC distinct; POD shorter than OOD; anterior carina of pronotal collar laterally curving towards pronotal lobe; head and mesosoma with regular impressed punctures; Gt 1 and Gt 3 immaculate.
Description. Female. ( Figs 1–8 ). Body length 12.31–12.54 mm ; fore wing 7.32–7.55 mm .

Median lobe of clypeus sharply indented into narrow semi-circle, no lateral denticles ( Fig. 4 ); IOC distinct, raised ( Fig. 3 ); POD 0.7 × OOD ( Fig. 2 ); black with following parts variously coloured: scape yellow; pedicel, fu 1 and fu 2 apically yellowish orange tending to brown in some specimens; mandible yellow with base and apex black; pronotal collar with anterior yellow patch; pronotal lobe yellow; axilla with faint yellow marking; scutellum with two large yellow maculae ( Fig. 5 ); fore and hind femora brown with yellow apical spot, fore and mid tibiae yellow with brown streaks outside; hind tibia brown with yellow streaks ventrally; Gt1 and Gt3 immaculate; Gt2 and Gt4 with large macula laterally, Gt 5 with dorso-median yellow band ( Figs 7 & 8 ).

Male
. ( Figs 9–14 ). Body length 8.46–8.90 mm ; fore wing 3.81–3.95 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8 .
Dasyproctus agilis (Smith)
♀. 1. Habitus, lateral view; 2. Head, dorsal view; 3. Head, frontal view; 4. Clypeus; 5. Mesosoma , dorsal view; 6. Mesosoma , lateral view; 7. Gt 1 & Gt 2 , dorsal view; 8. Metasoma, lateral view.

FIGURES 9–14 .
Dasyproctus agilis (Smith)
♂. 9. Habitus, lateral view; 10. Head, dorsal view; 11. Head, frontal view; 12. Clypeus; 13. Mesosoma , dorsal view; 14. Metasoma, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Median lobe of clypeus produced, apical margin truncated ( Fig. 12 ); conspicuous longitudinal carina on clypeus; frons and vertex with dense, fairly marked punctation; IOC distinct ( Fig. 11 ); Gt 1 robust, short; mandible, axilla and scutellum black ( Fig. 13 ); fore and mid femora brown with apical yellow spot, fore and mid tibiae yellow with ventral brown streak not extending till apex; hind femur brown with faint yellow spot apically; hind tibia brown, yellow ventrally; Gt 1 and Gt 3 immaculate; Gt 2 and Gt 4 each with large yellow macula laterally; Gt 5 with dorso-median yellow band ( Fig. 14 ).

Distribution. India : Bihar , Himachal Pradesh , Karnataka (new state record), Kerala (new state record), Meghalaya , Mizoram (new state record), Nagaland (new state record), Odisha (new state record), Sikkim , Tamil Nadu (new state record), Tripura (new state record), Uttar Pradesh , West Bengal . Elsewhere: Australia ; Indonesia ; Japan ; Malaysia ; Pakistan ; Philippines ; Singapore ; Sri Lanka ; Taiwan ; Thailand ; Vietnam ( Pulawski 2021 ).
